Key Match Events: Tyler Herro scored 26 points on 25 shots
Jaime Jaquez Jr. recorded 16 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists
DeMar DeRozan made two big shots in the fourth quarter
Haywood Highsmith blocked a shot to seal the win in overtime
Post-Match Reflections: The lasting takeaway from the game is how difficult it was for Miami to get Tyler Herro into his comfort spots
Miami's offense couldn't afford the lack of Herro's touches
The team will learn how to consistently take advantage of the zone defense
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went to double overtime
The HEAT fell behind by five points early in the second overtime
Miami's zone defense struggled to box out and led to 18 offensive boards for the Kings
The Kings won despite an 82.4 first-shot Offensive Rating on halfcourt possessions
Others: The game was an ugly, exciting matchup where neither team shot well
The Kings' offense was inefficient on second-chance points
The HEAT's zone defense was effective in the first half but struggled in the second half
